SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

fr.enstb.xmlcode
Class KeyValueDecoder

java.lang.Object
  fr.enstb.xmlcode.KeyValueDecoder

public class KeyValueDecoder
extends java.lang.Object

KeyValueDecoder is an utility class that allow to manipulate (get methods) properties of object (field or get/set methods pair) from values represented as String (very usefull for xml coding/decoding)

Those operations are done using the java.lang.reflect package and all developments done in KeyValueProperty class.
This class is used in the context of XML coding using a mapping model allowing to instanciate directly object from XML strings or streams (and reverse operation).
Manipulated types are all the java primitives (int, long, short, double, float, boolean, byte, char) or a Date, a String a File or a URL)

Author:
Sylvain Guerin
See Also:
XMLCoder, XMLDecoder, XMLMapping, KeyValueCoder

valueForKey

public static java.lang.String valueForKey(java.lang.Object object,
                                           SingleKeyValueProperty keyValueProperty)
                                    throws InvalidObjectSpecificationException

Returns value of keyValueProperty keyValueProperty represented as String, asserting that corresponding keyValueProperty type is a java primitive (int, long, short, double, float, boolean, byte, char) or a Date, a String a File or a URL)

No assertion is done on specific type and value is returned according to corresponding type.

Parameters:
object - an Object value
keyValueProperty - a KeyValueProperty value
Returns:
a String value
Throws:
InvalidObjectSpecificationException - if keyValueProperty type is not a java primitive nor a Date nor a String
